occurrenceRemarks:
[underlined] List of Aboriginal place names, etc 
In South-West of Western Australia [/underlined]

The aboriginal name of BUSSELTON in Undalup, named after Undal, 
who was a great warrior.

Balbookurngynieup   The place where he stops.

Boogigup                   Something to do with ground. The present day half-caste aboriginals are not sure. The name is supposed to be very ancient.

Boola Boona              The place of many trees.

Carbernup                   The place of shags.

Cowaramup                The place of parakeets. Every year during Springtime, large flocks of parakeets, the aboriginal name of which is "cowar" congregated there in very large quantities for a rest, and the aboriginals, in 
                                    a way peculiar to themselves, trapped them in thousands. [crossed out] consequently the name of Cowaramup. [/crossed out]

Karlgardup                  The place of fire. 
Karlgardup (Bunbury)    The place of seaweed smell.

Meegeejup                   The place of banksia nuts.

Miarmup                       Place of a hut. At one time a mysterious hut was found there. [crossed out] consequently the name. [/crossed out]

Milyanup                      The place of Milyan, who was the wife of Wooditch.

Modgegup                     The place of bluegums.

Moolyarup                     The place where nose piercing was done (near Ellensbrook)

Ngocardup.                  The place where Ngocardan, a great warrior, died. 

Ngocardup                    The place of lying down.

Quarggermiarup           The home of Quaggers (Brown Wallabies)

Quandingirup                The place of many queanders. (Bandicoots)

Qualup                          The place of white sand.

occurrenceRemarks:
Quinderlup                                                                   The place of bandicoots (queanders).
Wagebeladgarup                                                         The place where an Emu drowned himself, <s>in
                                                                                     a peculiar way. (Following this name I will
                                                                                     give the little story of how the place got
                                                                                     its name.)</s> Once when a band of aboriginals
                                                                                     was <s>were</s> hunting in this locality, they became
                                                                                     thirsty. <s>and</s> knowing of a tree which had
                                                                                     water in it, they all went to it to get
                                                                                     a drink. <s>from the tree waterhole</s> When
                                                                                     they got there they found a full-sized
                                                                                     <s>emu </s> dead [emu evidently drowned], with his head caught in the lower
                                                                                     part of the entrance to this tree [water]hole,
                                                                                    <s>evidently drowned, so</s> [consequently] they came to the con-
                                                                                     clusion that Wagebeladgarup would be an
                                                                                     appropriate name for the place, <s>meaning
                                                                                     the place where an emu drowned himself.</s>
                                                                                     The emu was quite fresh, so they roasted
                                                                                     and ate him.
Wagerup                                                                      The place of emus.

                                                                                    most of their digging sticks, <s>there</s> which

Yay Bungitch! nooduck injal Yennie yayer      Hello Bungitch! you where going now

Nghine yayyer daindernung moonyen quagger dullung wammign <s>dadger</s>dadjer kidjie      I now thicket going quagger hunting other meat and     

Nghine <s>c</s>kartage ally daindernung boolign dadger yuckie.      I understand that thicket plenty meat staying.

Mulacan yayer injal? <s>C</s>Koolarnger kidjie?      Mulacan now where? Children also?

Balarl yayer nguallarng yalyen.      They now behind coming.

Ally <s>c</s>koolarnger boolign murringne kuttuck      Those children plenty food have.

 <s>Kyia</s> KIYA balarl boolign <s>c</s>kuttuck.      Yes they plenty have.

Ally ngeand yalyennie?      That who here coming?

Ally be Ngogoran.      That is Ngogoran.

Nghe ngeanung gidjie?      This whose spear?

Bungitchung gidjie.      Bungitch's spear.

Ngeanung <s>c</s>koolarnger be nghe yennar?      Whose children are these all?

Nghe <s>c</s>koolarnger yennar be ngarnung.      These children all are mine.

Narlighn?      How many?

Koojal koolarng koojal mandegar kidgie.      Two boys, two girls and.

Yorger yayer injal?      Wife now where?

Wayamut yorger wanie <s>c</s>korkinuck.      Poor wife died yesterday.

Noonung chooker Mittan yayer injal yuckie?      Your sister Mittan now where staying?

Milyanup barl yuckie yayer.      Milyanup she staying now.

occurrenceRemarks:
ILLUSTRATIONS OF LITERAL TRANSLATIONS
OF NATIVE LANGUAGE.
ABORIGINAL                                                                                                                               ENGLISH
Nghine yayer yen bome-wainie barl                                                                                                I now go kill it.
Ally marrie yearer boolign Koomarl yuckie yayer.                                                                           That red gum up plenty opossum stopping now.
Narlighn Koomarl noonduck yayer kuttuck?                                                                                    How many opossums you now have?
<s>C</s>Koojarl marer nghine yayer Kuttuck                                                                                Two hands I now have (otherwise ten).
Ally quabba.                                                                                                                                   That's good.
Ally yardie.                                                                                                                                      That what ever can it be.
      (Yardie is a word used in case
       of doubt and expresses a lot
       of words, as it were, all in
       one.)
Ally narng?                                                                                                                                   That what (What's that)
Yongherung Morba boolign nghine kuttuck.                                                                                 Kangaroo skins plenty I have.                                           
                                                                                                                                               
Miaruck nghine janger youngie; barl;                                                                                           Tomorrow I whitefellow give
        nghich boolign bnoyer youngie                                                                                             <s>it</s>]; he me plenty money give.
Narlighn noonduck yayer kuttuck?                                                                                                How many you now have?
Koojal marer, murdine gunnar.                                                                                                      Two hands, three perhaps.
Miaruck boolign gunnar.                                                                                                                Tomorrow plenty perhaps.
Miaruck noonduck injal beejee                                                                                                      Tomorrow you where sleep
         geedarluck.                                                                                                                                 at night?
Kilkarnup gunnar.                                                                                                                          Kilkarnup perhaps.
Boolign kartern yayer Kilkarnup                                                                                                    Plenty groper now Kilkarnup
         wattern yuckie                                                                                                                           sea stay.
Boolign kulter, ngarie kidjie.                                                                                                          Plenty mullet, salmon and
Borung walger mia ally-war kidjie.                                                                                                 Big eagle nest that place
                                                                                                                                                              also.

occurrenceRemarks:
( Conclusion to Key to Dictionary)
ILLUSTRATIONS OF LITERAL TRANSLATIONS OF NATIVE LANGUAGE.]
ABORIGINAL                                                                                                                   ENGLISH
Nghine yayer yen bome-wainie barl                                                                                 I now go kill it.
Ally marrie yearer boolign Koomarl yuckie yayer                                                            [There are now plenty of opposums up that red gum tree.] That red gum up plenty opossum <s>stopping</s> with now.
                                                                                                                                               
Narlighn Koomarl noonduck yayer  kuttuck?                                                                   How many opossums you now have?
                                                                                                                               
Koojarl mar^r^er nghine yayer Kuttuck                                                                            [Ten] (Two hands I now have)
                                                                                                                                       <s>(otherwise ten).</s>
Ally quabba.                                                                                                                    [<s>that</s>] That's good. [(That good)}
Ally yardie. [?]                                                                                                                 [Oh! what you got there?] (That what ever can it be.)
       (Yardie is a word used in case
        of doubt and expresses a lot
        of words, as it were, all in
        one.)    
Ally narng?                                                                                                                    (That what) (What's  that)
<s>Yongherung<s> Yonkerung Morba boolign nghine Kuttuck.                                     Kangaroo skins plenty I have.
                                                                                                                                
[X] Miaruck nghine janger youngie barl;                                                                       [Tomorrow I will give it to a whitefellow; He will give me plenty of money.] (Tomorrow I whitefellow give
             nghich boolign bnoyer youngie                                                                       it; <s>he</s> [me] plenty money give.
Narlighn noonduck yayer kuttuck?                                                                               How many you now have?
Kooja^r^l mar^r^er, murdine gunnar.                                                                             [Two or three perhaps] (Two hands, three perhaps.)
Miaruck boolign gunnar.                                                                                              [I may get plenty to-morrow] (Tomorrow plenty perhaps.)
Miaruck noonduck injal beejee                                                                                    [where will you sleep to-morrow night] (Tomorrow you where sleep
         geedarluck.                                                                                                                     at night?)
Kilkarnup gunnar.                                                                                                        Kilkarnup perhaps.
Boolign kartern yayer Kilkarnup                                                                                   [There are now plenty of groper in the sea at Kilkarnup] (Plenty groper now Kilkarnup
        wattern yuckie                                                                                                      sea <s>stay</s>. [with])
Boolign kulter, ngarie kidjie.                                                                                        [There are also plenty of mullet salmon] Plenty mullet, salmon <s>and</s> [also]
Borung walger mia ally-war kidjie.                                                                               [There is a big eagles nest there too] (Big eagle nest that place
                                                                                                                                    also.)
